data.title: Engineering Services
data.meta_description: The Bacon Farmer Workman and Marcum Engineering family of companies are committed to providing multi-disciplined, full-service engineering.
data.text:
Structural Engineer

Ronald Bacon, PE, PLS, SE

Biography:

Ron has extensive experience in the field of engineering and has been a Principal of BFW since joining the firm in 1998. Mr. Bacon specializes in structural projects for the firm and has provided project management services for a wide variety of clients, including state and local government agencies including numerous Departments of Transportation throughout the southeast. His federal agency clients include FHSW, HUD, FAA, and the Corps of Engineers among others.

Education & Experience:

University of Kentucky B.S., Civil Engineering, 1977

Professional Registration:

Licensed Professional Engineer in the states of Illinois, Ohio, Tennessee and Kentucky

Licensed Professional Civil Engineer in the state of Kentucky

Licensed Professional Structural Engineer in the state of Kentucky

Licensed Professional Land Surveyor in the state of Kentucky

President | Principal Engineer

Christopher Farmer, PE

Biography:

Chris has extensive experience in the field of engineering and is a founding Principal of BFW. Mr. Farmer’s responsibilities include all aspects of proposal development, project management, client relations, and design/analysis of various geotechnical, general civil engineering and environmental projects. In addition, Mr. Farmer supervises and manages each facet of Bacon Farmer Workman Engineering & Testing, Inc.’s soil and material testing laboratory.

A sample of Mr. Farmer’s engineering design experience includes foundation and retaining wall design, slope stability analysis, and stormwater impoundments. Mr. Farmer’s environmental experience includes environmental soil and groundwater investigations, site assessments, landfill groundwater studies, air monitoring, and design/implementation of corrective action plans for the remediation of soil and groundwater.

Education & Experience:

University of Louisville – MEng., Civil Engineering, 1992

University of Louisville – B.S., Civil Engineering, 1991

Professional Registration:

Licensed Professional Civil Engineer in the state of Kentucky

Licensed Professional Engineer in the states of Tennessee, Ohio, Indiana, Missouri, Mississippi, Louisiana and Alabama

Executive Vice President

Mark Workman

Biography:

Mr. Workman holds a degree from Murray State University and is one of the founding members of BFW.

Mark serves as both the firms’ Executive Vice President and CEO, and oversees all proposal development, marketing, project management, and client relations for the firm. In addition, Mark also oversees employee recruitment, retention, and employee relations at all eight of the firm’s locations. Mark began his career in municipal government and has extensive experience in the management of multi-discipline engineering firms.

Education & Experience:

B.S. Murray State University, 1992

Current Chairman of the Kentucky Employers Mutual Insurance (KEMI) Board

Current Vice-Chairman of Paducah Power Board

Board member of the Paducah Economic Development Corporation

Board Member Paducah Area Chamber of Commerce

Former Board Member of the United Way of Paducah-McCracken County

Former Member of the Luther F. Carson Center for the Performing Arts

Principal | Mechanical Engineer

Baccus Oliver, PE, CxA, LEED AP

Biography:

Baccus has extensive experience in all aspects of heating, ventilation, air conditioning, refrigeration, plumbing, fire suppression, and mechanical design including ductwork, piping systems, steam systems, and insulation systems. Baccus is also experienced in project conception, project cost estimating, creation of engineering drawings, specifications/contracts, project scheduling, project quality, and cost control. Baccus is a Principal at Marcum Engineering, LLC and serves as Project Manager and Mechanical Engineer for all major projects.

Education & Experience:

University of Kentucky

B.S., Mechanical Engineering, 1992

Professional Affiliation:

Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) Accredited Professional

American Society of Heating, Refrigerating, and Air-Conditioning Engineers

American Society of Plumbing Engineers

Code Administrators Association of Kentucky

The International Ground Source Heat Pump Association

National Society of Professional Engineers

Kentucky Society of Professional Engineers

National Fire Protection Association

Professional Registration:

Licensed Professional Engineer in the states of Illinois, Tennessee, Missouri, and Kentucky

Structural Engineer | Project Manager

Joshua Alstat, PE,SE

Biography:

Josh is a registered Illinois Professional Civil Engineer working out of our Marion, Illinois, location. He has experience in structural engineering project design and management. Josh specializes in design, construction, and inspection of low-rise commercial/municipal buildings, schools, hospitals, churches, and industrial structures. He has experience with new construction as well as renovation projects.

Education & Experience:

Southern Illinois University, Carbondale – Bachelor of Science, Civil Engineering, 2015

Professional Registration:

Licensed Professional Engineer in the State of Illinois

Licensed Structural Engineer in the State of Illinois

Licensed Professional Engineer in the State of Kentucky

Project Engineer

Elijah Arterburn, PE, LEED AP BD+C

Biography:

Elijah joined Marcum Engineering in 2018 and has experience in mechanical engineering design. He serves as a project engineer/mechanical engineer. Elijah is a graduate of the University of Kentucky, and began his career here at Marcum Engineering while pursing his degree. He provides mechanical design, support, and oversight on various projects for both new buildings and extensive renovations. His experience includes design on K-12 schools, colleges and universities, corporate offices, hospitals, and light industrial.

Education & Experience:

University Of Kentucky – Mechanical Engineering, Bachelor of Science, 2020

Professional Registration:

Licensed Professional Engineer in the state of Kentucky

LEED Accredited Professional in Building Design and Construction

Mechanical Engineer | Project Manager

Bryan Atkins, PE

Biography:

Bryan joined Marcum Engineering in 2008 and has extensive experience in mechanical engineering design and serves as project manager/mechanical engineer. A graduate of the University of Kentucky, Bryan began his career while pursuing his degree, here with us at Marcum Engineering. Bryan provides mechanical engineering design and oversight on numerous types of projects including educational, judicial, corporate, renovation, and medical projects.

Education & Experience:

University of Kentucky

Bachelor of Science, Mechanical Engineering, 2008

Professional Registration:

Licensed Professional Engineer in the state of Kentucky

Senior Geotechnical Engineer

David Barker, PE

Biography:

Mr. Barker joined BFW in 2023 to be part of the new geotechnical engineering team located in the Nashville, Tennessee area. Mr. Barker has over 43 years of experience in geotechnical engineering with 39 years of service for the State of Tennessee Department of Transportation. After graduating from the University of Tennessee, David began with TDOT as an entry level geotechnical engineer in the Knoxville, Tennessee, office and advanced to supervisory and managerial positions. In 2009, Mr. Barker became the manager of the Knoxville Geotechnical Engineering Office and served in that position before retiring from state service in 2019. In addition to his work on general highway-related projects such as conventional retaining walls and bridge foundations, David has been involved with numerous geotechnical engineering challenges such as sinkhole mitigation, rockfall hazard analysis, and mitigation including rock bolts, dowels, draped and anchored wire mesh, and landslide analysis and mitigation including active anchored blocks and passive anchored shotcrete beams. Since retiring from TDOT, Mr. Barker has worked as a senior geotechnical engineer for private engineering consultant firms.

Education & Experience:

University of Tennessee

Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering

Certifications:

Licensed Professional Engineer, State of Tennessee

Chief Financial Officer

David Belt

Biography:

David joined BFW/Marcum as Chief financial Officer in 2015 after 14 years as CFO with a large construction and construction materials company operating multiple entities in over 15 states. There he served in the senior most financial position as a member of the leadership team providing financial and non-financial data and knowledge to facilitate, support, and impact management decision making and planning. David began his career in public accounting where he spent 13 years, including 8 years as a partner, providing traditional as well as non-traditional accounting and financial consulting services.

Education & Experience:

Murray State University, B.S. Accounting

Certifications:

Certified Public Accountant

Certified Construction Industrial Financial Professional

Nashville Branch Manager | Principal Geotechnical Engineer

Matt Bullard, PE

Biography:

Matt joined BFW in 2022 to start a new BFW office in Nashville, TN. He has amassed over 15 years of engineering experience in Tennessee and Kentucky. Matt has won and managed numerous TDOT contracts and been fortunate enough to work on some of TDOT’s most notable projects such as the Fast Fix 8 and the I-24/I-75 Interchange. He has alternative contracting experience in both Design-Build and CM/GC projects. Matt also has significant aviation, utility, industrial, commercial, and residential project experience.

Education & Experience:

Auburn University, Bachelor of Civil Engineering

Professional Registration:

Licensed Professional Engineer in the state of Tennessee and Kentucky

Environmental Manager

Susannah Campbell, PMP®

Biography:

Susannah joined the BFW team in 2019 as an Environmental Manager in our Paducah, Kentucky, office. She handles numerous environmental projects involving NEPA Compliance, Wetland Permitting, KPDES Permits, Air Permitting, Remedial Investigations, Mold Sampling, Asbestos Sampling, Lead Base Paint Inspections, Groundwater Protection Plans, Best Management Practices, etc. She possesses a strong background in leadership over a variety of projects with strong communication skills and proven client relationships. With Susannah’s wealth of experience, she is a great asset to our team!

Education & Experience:

Bachelor of Science, University of Kentucky, Mechanical Engineering/Mathematics

Bachelor of Science, Murray State University, Finance/Mathematics

Professional Registration:

Project Management Professional (PMP®)

Business Development

Steve Carter

Biography:

Steve Carter joined BFW/Marcum in August of 2023. He retired as Superintendent from McCracken County Schools after 27 years in public education with 21 of those serving in building and district-level leadership overseeing numerous programs and departments including facilities, maintenance, and transportation. Steve has been an active member of the Kentucky Association of School Administrators having served as President for 2018-2019.

Education & Experience:

Western Kentucky University

Bachelor of Arts

Murray State University

Master of Arts in Education

Transportation Engineer | Project Manager

Timothy Choate, PE, PLS

Biography:

Tim has extensive experience in the transportation/civil engineering field. Mr. Choate joined BFW after retiring from the Kentucky Transportation Cabinet where he served as the Branch Manager for Project Development in the District One office in Paducah, Kentucky. While in his previous position, Tim was responsible for implementing the Highway Plan for District One and managing the planning, design, right of way, and utility staff within District One. Tim also served as Project Manager on the majority of Consultant projects and monitored in-house design projects.

Education & Experience:

Murray State University-Bachelor of Science-Civil Engineering Technology, 1979

University of Kentucky-Bachelor of Science-Civil Engineering, 1985

Professional Registration:

Licensed Professional Engineer in the state of Kentucky

Licensed Professional Land Surveyor in the state of Kentucky

Business Development

James Codell, III

Biography:

James Codell, III joins BFW with over 60 years of experience in the A/E/C industry. Jim served as Cabinet Secretary of the Kentucky Transportation Cabinet from 1996 to 2004, Mr. Codell was responsible for all transportation operations for the State of Kentucky. Since 2004, Jim has served as Principal in Charge on various transportation projects in Illinois, Missouri, and Mississippi.

Jim served as Executive Vice President of Codell Construction Company for 24 years prior to his service as Secretary of Transportation. His experience there included directing the operations of the business and representing the company in numerous projects for CSX Transportation, Inc., Norfolk Southern Corporation, Kentucky Department of Highways, Indiana Department of Transportation, East Kentucky Power Cooperative, as well as a section of the Trans Alaskan Pipeline.

Education & Experience:

Morehead State University

B.S. Business Administration

Transportation Engineer | Project Manager

Tim Craven, PE

Biography:

Tim joins BFW after 31 years of experience with the Illinois Department of Transportation in the Bureau of Bridges and Structures. His position as the Bridge Project Planning Unit Chief includes 29 years of bridge planning for the structural, geometric, and economical analysis of bridges and structures. He supervised the development, review, and approval of Bridge Condition Reports, Type Size and Location plans, structural work estimates, and various consultant services. In addition, he participated in alternate methods of contracting, research projects, and various coordination outside of the department.

Education & Experience:

Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering, Iowa State University

Professional Registration:

Licensed Professional Engineer in the State of Illinois

Licensed Professional Engineer in the State of Indiana

IDOT Bridge Inspector – Bridge Program Manager

Transportation Engineer | Project Manager

Kevin Crider, PE, PTOE

Biography:

Kevin Crider has been a key member of the BFW transportation team since 2001 and has extensive experience in managing projects for a wide variety of clients including state and local government agencies.

Kevin has experience in rural and urban roadway design, specializing in hydrology issues relating to transportation projects, and has been involved in numerous projects in Kentucky, Tennessee, Illinois, Mississippi, Missouri, and Alabama.

Education & Experience:

Southern Illinois University

B.S., Civil Engineering, 1995

Professional Registration:

Licensed Professional Civil Engineer in the state of Kentucky, Illinois, Missouri, Tennessee, Indiana, and Arkansas

Professional Traffic Operations Engineer

Civil Designer

David Curtsinger, PLS

Biography:

David joined the BFW team in 2013 in the Civil-Site Department as a Civil Designer. He has over 30 years of experience in the Construction, Civil Engineering, and Transportation fields. He has been involved in the design and development of engineering plans for numerous site development, water and wastewater, and highway projects in his career. Being a registered professional surveyor in the state of Kentucky, he has also completed a good number of land survey plats.

Education & Experience:

Murray State University – Bachelor of Science, Civil Engineering Technology, 1985

Professional Registration:

Licensed Professional Land Surveyor in the state of Kentucky

Wetland Scientist / Ecologist

Laura Darnell, PWS

Biography:

Laura joined BFW in 2023 with extensive experience in the wetland and ecological consulting fields, including 18 years at Resource Environmental Solutions and Redwing Ecological Services in Louisville, Kentucky. She has expertise in U.S. Army Corps of Engineers wetland delineation methodologies as well as vegetation surveys and threatened / endangered species habitat assessments and surveys. Laura has managed projects for a variety of public and private sector clients that have included Section 401 and Section 404 permit applications, biological assessments, environmental assessments, mitigation plans, mitigation monitoring reports, and Wildlife Habitat Council certification.

Education & Experience:

Bachelor of Science in Biology, University of Kentucky

Master of Science in Environmental Science, Washington State University

Professional Registration:

Professional Wetland Scientist (PWS), Society of Wetland Scientists

Structural Engineer | Project Manager

Theresa Davies, PE

Biography:

Theresa is a registered Professional Engineer and office manager of our Evansville, Indiana, location. She joined BFW in 2022 after 15 years working in an engineering consulting firm which focused on the design of commercial projects including: schools, hospitals, municipal buildings, churches, and industrial structures. She has experience with both new construction and renovation projects.

Theresa earned a B.S. in Engineering degree from Purdue University. She has concentrated her professional abilities in the area of structural engineering and is a registered professional engineer in the state of Indiana.

Education & Experience:

Purdue University

B.S., Civil Engineering, 2001

Professional Registration:

Licensed Professional Engineer in the state of Indiana

Director of Proposal Development

Samantha Dennee

Biography:

Samantha has been an instrumental part of the Bacon Farmer Workman and Marcum Engineering team since joining the firm in 2000. Samantha currently serves as Marketing Director and is directly responsible for proposal development, website and social media management, and development of all marketing and advertising materials for the firm. A graduate of Southern Illinois University, Samantha is a native of Carterville, Illinois, but now calls Western Kentucky home.

Education & Experience:

Southern Illinois University – Bachelor of Science-1999

Testing & Inspections | Project Manager

Danny Dowell

Biography:

Danny has over eighteen years of experience in the fields of engineering, project management, and construction inspections. Danny’s extensive experience in the field of project management includes site visits, inspections, and verification of all phases of the project form site work to completion, progress meetings, and certified monthly invoicing.

As lead construction administrator, Danny helps to ensure a smooth running process on each project from beginning to end, as well as provide well qualified technical personnel to ensure the required specifications of the project have been met.

University of Missouri-Rolla – Bachelor of Science-1996

Bachelor of Science – Mechanical Engineering 1996

Resident Engineer | Project Manager

Stacy Earnhart, PE

Biography:

Stacy has over 20 years of experience in multiple aspects of engineering. She worked in highway design at MODOT for 6 years and spent 8 years as a County Engineer in Pulaski County, IL, including supervising and directing all design, maintenance, and operations of the county highway department. Most recently Stacy has worked as an independent contractor acting in the roles of resident engineer and construction inspector on numerous projects throughout District Nine as well as working with local governments to see projects completed.

Southern Illinois University

Bachelor of Science, Civil Engineering

Licensed Professional Engineer in the state of Illinois

IDOT Documentation of Contract Quantities

Transportation Engineer | Project Manager

Blake Emery, PE, PTOE

Biography:

Blake is a registered Illinois Professional Engineer working out of our Marion location as a transportation engineer. Blake holds his engineering degree from the University of Evansville and has been working for BFW since 2008. Blake is involved in all types of projects for BFW, including transportation, structural, and civil/site design projects. In addition, Blake is a Professional Traffic Operations Engineer, having gained that credential in 2011.

University of Evansville

Bachelor of Science, Civil Engineering, 2006

Senior Geophysicist

Boston Fodor, RG, PMP®

Biography:

Boston joined BFW in 2022 as a Senior Geophysicist. He has amassed over 15 years of professional experience in the consulting industry. This experience includes more than 10 years performing various geophysical evaluations for municipal, commercial, industrial, and military projects. Additionally, Boston has managed large Federal AE design and study projects.

Saint Louis University

Bachelor of Science, Geophysics

Professional Registration:

Registered Geologist in the State of Missouri

Certified Project Management Professional

Senior Project Accountant

Sandy Givens

Biography:

Sandy joined BFW in May 2023. Sandy came here from the Housing Authority of Paducah, a non-profit entity that provides affordable housing to low-income individuals and families in Paducah, where she was Director of Finance for 8 years. There she was a member of senior management providing financial data, knowledge, and experience to assist in the decision-making process. Sandy began her career in accounting with the Kentucky Department of Revenue where she worked as a Tax Auditor for the Commonwealth of Kentucky. From there, she transitioned to public accounting where she spent almost 16 years providing accounting services to many businesses and individuals in our community.

Education & Experience:

Murray State University,

Bachelor of Science, 1990

Professional Affiliation:

Certified Public Accountant

Civil Engineer | Project Manager

Brad Gough, PE

Biography:

Brad joined the BFW team in 2017 as a project engineer in the Civil Department. He has extensive experience in civil engineering, performing environmental assessments for federal clients, as well as land development design, permitting, and consulting. Brad has previous land development experience in Tampa FL, Dallas TX, and Paducah KY including various single-family, multi-family, commercial, retail, municipal, and medical projects. He is currently a registered professional in Kentucky, Tennessee, and Ohio.

Education & Experience:

Ohio University, BS Civil Engineering, 2005

Professional Registration:

Licensed Professional Engineer in the states of Kentucky, Tennessee and Ohio

Director of Business Development

Craig Guess

Biography:

Craig Guess has joined BFW as Director of Business Development.

Guess was CEO of a construction company that he grew from $2 million to $100 million over his 30 tenure. The company operated in 26 states and clients included NASA, Army Corps of Engineers, Department of Homeland Security, and the Department of Fish & Wildlife.

He served as chairman of the Paducah Area Chamber of Commerce and Kentucky Chamber of Commerce boards and twice as chairman of the WKCA-AGC Board of Directors. He also served on the AGC of America Board of Governors. He is a graduate of Leadership Kentucky and is currently a member of the Rotary Club of Paducah and YPO/World Presidents Organization.

People Operations Administrator

Rae Hall

Biography:

Rae joins BFW with 20 years of human resources experience in the financial industry. Her expertise is in benefits packages, workplace wellness initiatives, human resources technology, and human resources compliance. Rae has extensive knowledge in physical & mental wellness programming, organizational development, employee recognition, and cultivating company culture.

Bachelor of Science in Biology

Mechanical Engineer | Project Manager

Jeff Halverson, PE, LEED AP

Biography:

Jeff hails from the Madison Wisconsin area and graduated from the University of Wisconsin-Madison, where he earned his Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering. Jeff began his career with Marcum Engineering during the Fall of 2013, and currently serves as a project manager for mechanical engineering projects. The majority of his work focuses on higher education, K-12, municipal, commercial, and renovation projects. Jeff is a Registered Professional Engineer in Kentucky and Wisconsin and is also a LEED Accredited Professional.

Transportation Project Engineer

Biography:

Doug joined BFW in July 2021 and has over 20 years of experience in transportation and civil engineering. He has worked with a variety of clients including state and local government agencies. Doug has design and management experience on projects throughout Illinois, Kentucky, Tennessee, Mississippi, Arkansas, and Alabama. His experience includes rural and urban roadway design, site development, utility relocations, and construction administration.

Biography:

Brandon is a registered Professional Engineer and a structural project engineer at our Marion, Illinois office. He joined BFW in 2019 after interning in the Mairon office for one summer during undergraduate at Southern Illinois University Edwardsville. Brandon has experience in structural design, construction, and inspection of low-rise commercial buildings, schools, hospitals, churches, and industrial structures. He has experience with new construction and renovation projects, and analysis of existing structures.

Biography:

Brian joined BFW Engineering & Testing, Inc. in 2021. Brian has 29 years experience in the construction engineering field with the Missouri Department of Transportation where he received experience in construction inspection and contract administration. Brian served as Resident Engineer for 21 years in 3 different project office locations within the Southeast District, where he led construction inspection staff overseeing the multiple construction projects.

Biography:

Justin is a licensed Professional Engineer who has worked out of the Paducah, KY office since joining BFW in 2019. He has experience in structural design, analysis, and inspection, as well as project management, seismic hazard assessment, and construction administration. Justin specializes in the design of commercial & municipal buildings, schools, hospitals, churches, and ICC 500/FEMA P-361 storm shelters & safe rooms.

Structural Engineer | Project Manager

Phillip Holthaus, PE, SE

Biography:

Phillip is a registered Professional Structural Engineer and office manager of our Champaign, Illinois, location. He joined BFW in 2008 working in structural engineering project design and eventually transitioned to structural project management. Phillip specializes in the design and inspection of commercial/municipal buildings, schools, hospitals, churches, and industrial structures. He has experience with new construction, renovation projects, and forensic investigations. Phillip’s variety of experience has allowed him to work on projects in high seismic zones, high wind zones, and where blast loading design is required.

Southern Illinois University – Carbondale

Transportation Engineer | Project Manager

Barry Horst, PE

Biography:

Barry comes to us with 32 years experience in the transportation engineering field. During his time with the Missouri Department of Transportation, he received experience in construction inspection and contract administration. He served as design team leader, District Chief Designer and ultimately Southeast District Design department manager. In his department manager position, he led the efforts of design, survey, and utility staff, as well as preparing the district right of way and construction program. Barry’s experience makes him a perfect fit to lead our new Cape Girardeau, Missouri office.

Executive Director of the Southeast Missouri Regional Planning and Economic Development Commission Bachelor of Science – Civil Engineering, Missouri University of Science and Technology

Structural Engineer/Project Manager

Anna Marie Ignacio, PE

Biography:

Anna Marie is a registered Professional Engineer and structural project engineer in our Champaign, Illinois location. She joined BFW in 2018 after 2 years working in railway construction. Anna Marie has experience in structural design, construction, and inspection of low-rise commercial, municipal buildings, schools, churches, and hotels. She has experience with new construction and renovation projects of varying materials including structural steel, concrete, masonry, wood, and cold-formed metal.

Senior Traffic Engineer

David Johnson, P.E.

Biography:

David joins Bacon Farmer Workman Engineering & Testing, Inc. after 6 years of experience with the Missouri Department of Transportation (MoDOT) in the Southeast District, and 2 years of experience with the U.S. Department of Veteran Affairs (VA). David worked in MoDOT’s Traffic Department and in their alternative project delivery division. David is experienced in signals, signing, striping, roadway safety analysis, and roadway capacity analysis. David is also experienced in Design-Build project delivery, construction inspection, and contract development. As Project Engineer with the VA, David managed Civil and Mechanical Design as well as Construction projects for VA Hospitals. David enjoys professional collaboration and problem-solving with an emphasis on improving traffic flow and safety for roadway users.

Education & Experience:

Southern Illinois University, Carbondale

Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering

Professional Registration:

Licensed Professional Engineer in Missouri

Environmental Project Manager

Leigh Ann Liddell

Biography:

Leigh Ann joins Bacon Farmer Workman Engineering & Testing, Inc. as an Environmental Project Manager working remotely in Charleston, South Carolina. Her background includes over 26 years of diverse experience in environmental consulting/project management, managing environmental programs in industrial settings, and ownership of a small environmental consulting business. Her expertise includes NEPA compliance, Section 404/401 and NPDES permitting, preparing technical documents such as SWPPPs and SPCC Plans, environmental auditing, hazardous waste management, and natural resource surveys. Throughout Leigh Ann’s career, she has developed strong organizational and communication skills and enjoys maintaining client relationships. Leigh Ann’s hobbies include native flora identification/ecology, outdoor activities, scientific research, and spending time with family and friends.

Maegan Mansfield, PE

Biography:

Maegan joined BFW after her tenure at the Paducah Gaseous Diffusion Plant. Her experience includes 5 years in the private sector as a geotechnical engineer, where she specialized in seismic foundation designs in ports, waterway crossings, and other transportation projects located near the Eastern coastline and across the United States. Additionally, Maegan has managed capital projects for the City of Paducah, and most recently gained experience as a senior civil engineer with Veolia Federal Solutions-Nuclear Services.

Dawn Mason

Biography:

Dawn joined BFW/Marcum in December 2020, coming from Harper Construction, a specialty concrete construction contractor, where she had been the financial controller for 5 years. Dawn began her career in public accounting where she spent 5 years providing audit and tax services to businesses of Western Kentucky and Southern Illinois, specializing in construction contracting and governmental/non-profit entities.

Biography:

Chris joined BFW in August 2021 after his tenure with a regional consulting firm as a geotechnical engineer. His experience includes over 10 years’ experience in the private sector as a geotechnical engineer, where he specialized in site specific seismic analysis, non-destructive and in-situ testing, foundation design and mine subsidence mitigation. Additionally, Chris has managed geotechnical services for a wide variety of both private and public projects

Transportation Engineer | Project Manager

Mike McGregor, PE

Biography:

Mr. McGregor has extensive experience in the transportation/civil engineering field. Mike joined Bacon Farmer Workman Engineering & Testing, Inc. after retiring from the Kentucky Transportation Cabinet. His experience includes 5 years as Chief District Engineer for KYTC in Paducah. Mike was responsible for administration, coordination, and direction of all programs and employees in Highway District 1. Additionally, Mr. McGregor served as Project Development, Project Delivery & System Preservation, and Construction Branch Manager throughout his career with KYTC. These positions carried responsibility for all aspects of the Design, Environmental Assessment, Right-of-Way Acquisition, Utility Relocation and Contract Administration for the 12 westernmost counties in Kentucky.

Engineer I | Project Manager

Frederick Mensah, PE

Biography:

Frederick is a Civil Engineer with over 9 years of experience as a Structural/Construction Engineer. In addition to his design and analyzing skills, he possesses a strong background in leadership. In Ghana and Uganda he supervised staff and monitored projects from start to finish, including 15 bridges, 18 buildings and hundreds of miles of roadway. We are fortunate to have him on our team!

Project Manager

Andy Meyer, P.E.

Biography:

Andy joins Bacon Farmer Workman Engineering & Testing, Inc. after 30 years of experience with the Missouri Department of Transportation in the Southeast District in various administrative and program delivery roles, culminating in Assistant District Engineer for Program Delivery. As Assistant DE, his responsibilities included supervising technical and engineering staff in planning, right-of-way acquisition, design, materials, construction, and local municipality project administration. Andy enjoys sharing his experiences working with multi-disciplinary core teams, alternate delivery strategies, and innovative project solutions.

Greg began his Civil Engineering career with the Illinois Department of Transportation where he rose through the ranks of Construction Inspector, Resident Engineer, Senior Resident Engineer and Supervising Field Engineer. Inland Waterways Technical Advisor

Christina Neutz Murphy

Biography:

Christina joined Bacon Farmer Workman in 2023 after working 38 years with the US Army Corps of Engineers – Louisville District Office. She graduated with a master’s degree in civil engineering and worked predominately her entire USACE career related to levee systems from design and construction to rehabilitation, inspection, flood fighting during high water events and review and processing of Section 408 requests.

She served as the Chief of Levee Safety and was the Louisville Districts levee safety subject matter expert. She was also the Project Delivery Team Lead and an author that contributed extensively to the updates of the Engineer Manual 1110-2-2902 Conduits, Pipes, & Culverts Associated with Dams & Levee Systems published in December of 2020. Her team consisted of approximately 10 USACE engineers and approximately 13 Pipe associations and other contractors on the updates to this EM.

Senior Transportation Engineer | Project Manager

John Negangard, PE

Biography:

We are pleased to announce that John has joined the BFW team as a Senior Transportation Engineer/Project Manager, operating out of our Springfield, Illinois, office. John has been with the Illinois Department of Transportation for 32 years prior to joining BFW in 2019. During his time with IDOT he held the positions of Operations Engineer/Bureau Chief of the Bureau of Operations, Studies and Plans Engineer, Studies and Plans Senior Squad Leader, Design Squad Leader, and Project Studies Engineer. During his career with IDOT he received recognition as District Six “Engineer of the Year,” AASHTO Quality Award, and District Six “Employee of the Year,” and various other awards throughout his career. With so much experience and accolades, we had to have him in our BFW family.

Geotechnical Engineer

Leonard Oliver, PE

Biography:

Mr. Oliver joined BFW in 2022 to be part of the new geotechnical engineering team to be located in the Nashville, Tennessee area. Mr. Oliver has over 40 years’ experience in geotechnical engineering with 32 years of service for the State of Tennessee Department of Transportation. Mr. Oliver began with TDOT as an entry level geotechnical engineer in the Nashville, TN office and advanced to supervisory and managerial positions. Mr. Oliver became the statewide manager for the Geotechnical Engineering Section and served in the position for 10 years before retiring from state service. As manager of the statewide Geotechnical Engineering Section, Mr. Oliver oversaw the development and implementation of numerous geotechnical engineering programs such as sinkhole mitigation, rockfall hazard analysis and mitigation, landslide analysis and mitigation, Acid Producing Rock (APR) analysis and mitigation, Retaining Wall design, analysis and plans development along with general transportation geotechnical related areas such as spread footings, piles, drilled shafts, and pavement subgrade analysis. Since retiring from TDOT, Mr. Oliver has worked as a senior geotechnical engineer for private engineering consultant firms.

Education & Experience:

Georgia Institute of Technology

Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering

Professional Registration:

Licensed Professional Engineer, State of Tennessee, since 1984

Transportation Engineer | Project Manager

Diana Radcliffe, PE

Biography:

Diana has extensive experience in Civil Engineering with emphasis on Transportation. Diana retired from the Kentucky Transportation Cabinet in April 2015 where she was most recently Director of Construction Procurement. She managed the statewide construction bid letting program which totaled a billion dollars each year. Prior to that position, Diana worked 25 years in the Division of Maintenance. She spent the previous 8 years as Branch Manager for the Roadway Preservation branch. She managed the statewide resurfacing program, the statewide guardrail program along with contract maintenance projects involving slide repair, JPC pavement, traffic striping, traffic signs, and emergency projects funded by FEMA and ER. Prior to the management position, she was a project manager for contract maintenance projects and pavement rehabilitation projects. She also proved QA/QC for maintenance projects.

Professional Land Surveyor

Clay Robinson, PLS

Biography:

Mr. Robinson has been involved in the transportation, civil site plan, water and wastewater industry since 1983, for the most part, in the survey of utility corridors utilizing the latest technology available. Our firm now utilizes Static GPS units to set permanent control monuments, Real Time Kinematic (RTK) GPS units to gather key topographic features and Aerial Photography to set images in the background of the plans to further help the Contractor and the Utility Owner to better understand the scope of the project. Mr. Robinson uses MicroStation, GeoPak and Topcon Surveying equipment to develop an accurate survey of the project.
